perturbation.original_text: Subject to Section 2.6, the Village Media Company shall, or shall cause HOFV to, pay to PFHOF a minimum guarantee of one million two hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($1,250,000) (the “Annual Guarantee”) each year during the Term; provided that the Parties acknowledge and agree that after the first five (5) years of the Term, the Annual Guarantee shall increase by three percent (3%) on a year-over-year basis (e.g., the Annual Guarantee shall increase to $1,287,500 for year six (6) and to $1,326,125 for year seven (7)). The first Annual Guarantee payment shall be due and payable on the Effective Date and thereafter shall be payable to PFHOF on each twelve (12) month anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to Section 2.6, the Village Media Company shall, or shall cause HOFV to, remit to PFHOF a minimum amount of one million two hundred and fifty thousand dollars ($1,250,000) (the “Annual Guarantee”) each year during the Term; provided that the Parties acknowledge and agree that after the first five (5) years of the Term, the Annual Sum shall increase by three percent (3%) on a year-over-year basis (e.g., the Annual Sum shall increase to $1,287,500 for year six (6) and to $1,326,125 for year seven (7)). The first Annual Sum payment shall be due and payable on the Effective Date and thereafter shall be payable to PFHOF on each twelve (12) month anniversary of the Closing Date during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Annual Guarantee” is now also referred to as “Annual Sum”, potentially creating confusion as to whether these are different obligations or merely different names for the same obligation.

perturbation.original_text: The Advisory Board’s function shall be to facilitate the consideration of opportunities presented to either or both of the Village Media Company and the HOF Media Company.
perturbation.changed_text: The Advisory Group’s function shall be to assist in reviewing the possible ventures brought to either or both of the Village Media Company and the HOF Media Company.
perturbation.explanation: The term “Advisory Board” is replaced with “Advisory Group,” and ‘consideration of opportunities’ is replaced by ‘assisting in reviewing the possible ventures’. This creates uncertainty as to whether the entities are one and the same and if there role has changed.

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Village Media Company and PFHOF, as applicable, agrees to be in material compliance with all federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, and regulations applicable to its respective operations and to obtain and maintain all licenses and permits required by law necessary for each of their respective operations.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Village Media Company and PFHOF, as applicable, agrees to abide by all federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, and policies relevant to its operations and to possess and keep current all licenses and authorizations required by law necessary for each of their operations.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'material compliance with all regulations' is changed to 'abide by all policies' and 'maintain all permits' is changed to 'keep current all authorizations'. This introduces ambiguity as to the stringency of the compliance standard and whether 'permits' and 'authorizations' cover the same scope.
